questions.question_text: What are the two components of an application-aware firewall? (Choose two.)
What are the two prerequisites for a Cloud OnRamp for SaaS feature to show the accurate vQoE score? (Choose two.)

choices.D: static route tracker for SaaS application
choices.C: Cloud OnRamp enabled on WAN Edge router

discussion.content:
The cisco guide for Cloud OnRamp SaaS requires that NAT to be enabled for VPN 0 and a default route that directs traffic out to the internet (This requirement is necessary for the interface to be a candidate for local exit, regardless of any other NAT configured for the site).

Options [A] & [B] 

Reference Link:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/CVD-SD-WAN-Cloud-onRamp-for-SaaS-Deployment-Guide-2018JUL.pdf

Selected Answer: AB
The requisites for Cloud OnRamp for Saas are:
- NAT on VPN0 => B
- Default Route and DIA => A
- DNS in VPN 0 => this is not Service VPN, so, E is worng
Correct Answer A & B

Selected Answer: AB
A and B for me.

questions.question_text: What is a requirement for a WAN Edge to reach vManage, vBond, and vSmart controllers in a data center?

comments.content: vEdge and vBond only use DTLS

discussion.content: OMP is between vSmart to vEdge , and vSmart to vSmart only. I think tha answes is D: TLS. any comment?

comments.content: at the time of bring up, there is a DTLS/TLS connection between vEdge and vBond, once the vEdge establishes connection to the vSart, the connection to the vBon is teared down.

discussion.content: vbond is never establish tls connection or OMP connection .

Selected Answer: D
D: TLS

For a WAN Edge to effectively reach vManage, vBond, and vSmart controllers in a data center, the use of TLS is a critical requirement. This security protocol is vital for establishing secure and reliable connections within the SD-WAN architecture. Understanding these concepts is important for anyone pursuing a CCNA certification, as it covers fundamental networking principles and security measures in modern network design.

The correct answer is D. TLS.

Explanation:
The WAN Edge devices must establish secure connections to the vManage, vBond, and vSmart controllers using TLS (Transport Layer Security). TLS is used to encrypt and secure communication between these components, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality. Without TLS, the WAN Edge devices would not be able to securely reach the controllers in the data center.

A requirement for a WAN Edge to reach vManage, vBond, and vSmart controllers in a data center is:

D. TLS

Transport Layer Security (TLS) is essential for establishing secure communication channels between the WAN Edge routers and the controllers (vManage, vBond, and vSmart) in the Cisco SD-WAN architecture.

attention to the question: What is a requirement for a WAN Edge to reach "vManage, vBond, and vSmart" controllers in a data center?
IGP or static routing is needed to get from WANEDGE to VBOND, but then DTLS/TLS tunnels need to be established for wan edge to reach VSMART, VMANAGE

note 1: I replace the IGP with static routing to reach the vbond , but I need DTLS/TLS for the wan edge to reach the other controllers
NOTE 2 vbond needs DTLS/TLS to authenticate the wANEDGE if that will never reach the controllers
link: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/security/vedge/security-book/security-overview.html
shows that the vBond can use TLS to connect to the wanEdge

after further review - IGP. vManage requires NETCONF over SSH and the others use DTLS by default.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/sdwan-wan-edge-onboarding-deploy-guide-2020nov.pdf

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/sdwan-wan-edge-onboarding-deploy-guide-2020nov.pdf
D(TLS) connect to each equipment. I beleive more in TLS.

Another doc proving d/TLS:

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/config-18-4.pdf#page=186

DTLS tunnels:
Cisco vBond Orchestrator orchestrates the initial control connection between Cisco vSmart Controllers and edge routers. It creates DTLS tunnels to the Cisco vSmart Controllers and edge routers to authenticate each node that is requesting control plane connectivity.

Selected Answer: B

questions.question_text: Which queue must an engineer configure for control and BFD traffic for convergence on a WAN Edge router?

discussion.content:
The localized data policy can control the flow of data traffic into and out of a vEdge router's interfaces and enables features such as QoS. The policies can be activated if you apply the access lists, either in the outbound direction or in the inbound direction.

Each interface has eight queues on hardware vEdge routers, numbered from 0 to 7. Queue 0 is reserved and is used for both control traffic and low-latency queuing (LLQ) traffic. For LLQ, any class that is mapped to queue 0 must also be configured to use LLQ. All control traffic is transmitted. Queues 1 to 7 are available for data traffic.
correct anwser is D

Selected Answer: A
A
BFD are in Queue 0 (LowLatencyQueue)

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/routers/vedge-router/213408-implement-qos-in-cisco-sd-wan.html

Control and BFD (Bidirectional Forwarding Detection) traffic is reserved for Queue 0
Option [A]

Selected Answer: A
Queue 0 is always configured as a low-latency queue and
is the only queue that supports Low Latency Queuing. Additionally, all control traffic
that is originated by the WAN Edge router, including DTLS/TLS, BFD probes, and rout-
ing protocol traffic, is automatically mapped to queue 0.
